entry.title: What I lost (and what it cost)
entry.summary:
Author: MamaCurry

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,822Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 3

Summary: “Eddie?” He finally spoke. Eddie choked out an exhale at the way he said his name, as if no time had passed. As if he hadn’t disappeared for two years. As if Eddie hadn’t hosted his wake. OR: Forensic scientist Eddie Diaz shows up to a crime scene prepared to berate the new firefighter who apparently contaminated the area. Imagine his surprise when he arrives and the man he finds is none other than his previously missing ex-husband.

entry.title: I Know There’s A Room Where I’m Happy… Let Me In, Let Me In
entry.summary:
Author: Buddieaya

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,870Chapters: 3/5Kudos: 28

Summary: He’d shoved the envelope into his pocket, fingers tightening around it like holding it too carefully might make it more real. Around him, everyone else slipped out quietly, one by one, each of them clearly ready or at least willing to face whatever Bobby had left behind for them.But Eddie stayed seated, and he was the last to leave.Not because he needed more time, but because he already knew he didn’t want to read it.He couldn’t read it.Or; After Bobby’s death, everyone at the 118 receives a letter he wrote before he passed. Eddie gets his and overwhelmed by guilt and grief, he doesn’t open it right away. Instead, he spirals, goes out, drinks too much, hooks up with a guy, and loses the letter.

entry.title: I wanna feel guilty
entry.summary:
Author: Ch3rryCxnt

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,532Chapters: 5/7Kudos: 10

Summary: Bobby is dead. Buck and Eddie find ways to support each other in the aftermath. They’re just two men carrying infinite grief and not enough language for it. Buck is falling apart, Eddie is numb. They don’t know how to move on without their Captain. Eddie wants to believe he’s normal, unbroken. While Buck just wants to be enough for someone before it’s too late. An aching story of guilt, grief, love and lust and the things strong men like them never say aloud.

entry.title: Fighting To Hold On
entry.summary:
Author: untoldchaos

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,326Chapters: 6/8Kudos: 71

Summary: Evan 'Buck' Buckley doesn't think of himself as a violent person. He forgets to remind himself of this fact as he draws his fist back and then hooks it around to strike his opponent. The returning blows come as a flurry of movement. First comes the impact, then a tingling sensation, and finally a throbbing pain radiating from Buck's jaw up to his temple and through his entire skull. He stumbles back; vision hazy, the faint metallic taste of blood in his mouth. Another hit lands before he has a chance to re-orientate himself, sending him falling backwards- hard. OrEddie has left for El Paso, so Buck needs a new hobby to keep distracted.Baking won't cut it.The solution is beginner MMA, obviously.And to make things more interesting, Buck's trainer shares a striking resemblance to his best friend.

entry.title: best friends, ex-friends 'til the end (better off as lovers)
entry.summary:
Author: drakesword

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 32,032Chapters: 12/40Kudos: 29

Summary: A lot of things are gay at this school, Eddie has noticed. It’s not necessarily a new phenomenon, but back in elementary school, that word was only ever hushed, giggled over, never dared to be said in front of the teachers, in fear of being scolded.Here, however, it’s shouted down hallways, said out loud in classrooms, written on blackboards, thrown at the heads of kids who dare to express themselves in the wrong way.So yeah, no thanks. Eddie would rather not approach, or even look at anyone with something remotely close to a social life at this school again. He doesn’t want to make himself a target.Because if there is one thing people should know about him, it’s this: Eddie Diaz is not gay. Or; AU where Buck and Eddie meet in middle school and quickly become best friends. But as they grow up alongside each other, their dynamic evolves more and more into something Eddie is not quite ready to face.

entry.title: The hands of the past
entry.summary:
Author: Primvrose

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,255Chapters: 9/9Kudos: 3

Summary: When Eddie receives a letter from a worried mother, asking him to save her child from her sickness, he travels 800 miles to a forgotten town in the middle of nowhere, haunted by its weather and the untold story of the mysterious guy who lives in the castle inside the forest. He faces the pessimism of the residents, the odds and himself trying to save the town from its inevitable decay.And maybe he finds love in the process.orEddie is a doctor, he comes to town to save a little girl from a cough and finds that Buck has a castle and is blamed for the death of dozens of people. —-----This is like a XVIII century AU, but from a different reality. The language and the way a few things work aren’t exactly made to fit the period.. Or nature? Idk.

entry.title: One Thousand One Hundred and Ten
entry.summary:
Author: anticlimacticstories

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,416Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 37

Summary: Once back home after dropping Chris off school, Buck stepped into the quiet house. The familiar creak of the door, the subtle scent of cinnamon and soap lingering in the air—it all felt the same. And yet, it wasn’t.Because it wouldn’t be quiet anymore.Eddie wrapped his arm around Buck’s waist, spinning him to capture his lips in a searing kiss, tongue delving into his mouth heatedly, Buck moaned as Eddie’s large hands roamed his curves, squeezing and kneading the flesh, starved by the touch like a dying man. He backs Buck towards the bedroom and onto the bed, never breaking the kiss, until the backs of Buck’s knees hit the mattress. As they parted for air, a string of saliva kept them entwined.“Welcome home, Eddie,” Buck managed to say, regaining his composure as Eddie flushed him closer against his chest.--Or in short: Eddie leaves for the army as a military veteran on a train station. entry.title: everything in its right place
entry.summary:
Author: slugcity

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,748Chapters: 3/6Kudos: 35

Summary: Scrubbing at his eyes, he padded toward the kitchen, where he heard the clanging of pots and pans like Buck was making pancakes.“Hey, that’s kind of a messed up prank to play on a guy, you know. I like the painting, though-“ Eddie froze. Maddie was in his kitchen. Maddie was wearing some sort of robe and her hair was messy like she had just woken up and she was drinking coffee out of a mug that said “I went to L.A. and all I got was this stupid T-shirt.” Maddie was standing in his kitchen, turning to look at him incredulously. Maddie was wearing house slippers and she was at the stove, making pancakes.“Babe, what prank? Did Chris or Lena pull something?"-----------For nearly his entire life, Eddie imagined himself as a husband to a wife. She would be kind and they would have at least two kids (another on the way), a house with a foyer, and a white picket fence. He never thought too hard about the wife part, he just wanted to marry someone who understood him.It takes a near death experience and a traipse through a life that could have happened to make him realize that everything he ever imagined for himself might not be what he wants. Maybe he just wants Buck.

entry.title: The Sun Will Shine Even When It's Covered by Clouds (So Will You)
entry.summary:
Author: solaris_sunspot

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,348Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 172

Summary: The sun was hidden behind the clouds, but that didn’t stop Evan. He ran out to the garage and pulled out Danny’s old bike to try and ride it. His parents were at work, Maddie was inside doing homework, and Danny was…well, he couldn’t remember where Danny was, he was pretty sure he was playing a video game. He had told Maddie and Daniel that he was gonna ride a bike, and they said he could, as long as one of them could see him from their spot in the house. Evan thought that was pretty fair, so here he was. He got onto the bike and tried to ride it, key word try. Dannys old bike didn’t have training wheels, which was hard, but he had to learn so he could ride his bike with Maddie and Danny! So he kept trying.

entry.title: Give Me a Sign
entry.summary:
Author: Rock_Paper

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,768Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 122

Summary: “I’ve had a chance to go through files from the past couple of years, and I found one that seemed to be… misplaced?” Her fingers settle over a manila envelope with “December 18th, 2018” scratched into the corner in Bobby’s boxy handwriting.“Okay? And what trouble did I get into 6 years ago?” Buck tilts his head to get a better look at the envelope.“I’m afraid your disclosure paperwork was never filed with the LAFD. It’s all filled out, minus the signatures, and it found its way to the bottom of the bottom drawer.""Disclosure with who?"-OR- Bobby filled out the paperwork years ago.
